How to Install jclic on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • jclic

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install jclic on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing jclic on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall jclic in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install jclic, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install jclic Using apt

To install jclic in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install jclic using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install jclic

The installation of jclic might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install jclic Using apt-get

To install jclic using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install jclic.

sudo apt-get -y install jclic

Install jclic Using Synaptic

To install jclic using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install jclic on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for jclic. This will display the jclic package in the package window, now to install jclic, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the jclic package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of jclic.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install jclic Using aptitude

To install jclic on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of jclic.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install jclic using the command aptitude install jclic.

sudo aptitude -y install jclic

How to Upgrade jclic on debian

If you want to upgrade the jclic package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade jclic using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade jclic to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade jclic.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade jclic sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade jclic

Upgrade jclic using Aptitude

To upgrade jclic using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade jclic.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade jclic

Upgrade jclic using Synaptic

To upgrade jclic using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for jclic, now right-click jclic, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade jclic just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall jclic on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall jclic from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just jclic, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove jclic

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of jclic

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of jclic you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge jclic

Remove jclic using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall jclic using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for jclic, right-click the jclic package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall jclic click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install jclic on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade jclic using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
